edu.doane.dugal.dea.kits.general

Class EvaluateThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinTask<java.lang.Void>
      • java.util.concurrent.RecursiveAction
        • edu.doane.dugal.dea.kits.general.EvaluateThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Void>

    public class EvaluateThread
extends java.util.concurrent.RecursiveAction
    Extension of RecursiveAction to evaluate the population using multiple threads.
    Version:
    04/13/2016
    Author:
    Mark M. Meysenburg
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructor and Description
      EvaluateThread(Problem prob, Individual[] pop, int start, int end)
      Construct a new EvaluateThread object to evaluate a portion of the population, using a threshold of 10.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EvaluateThread

        public EvaluateThread(Problem prob,
                      Individual[] pop,
                      int start,
                      int end)
        Construct a new EvaluateThread object to evaluate a portion of the population, using a threshold of 10.
        Parameters:
        prob - Problem used to evaluate individuals.
        pop - Population to evaluate.
        start - Index of first individual in the population to evaluate.
        end - Index of last individual in the population to evaluate.

    • Method Detail

      • compute

        protected void compute()
        Specified by:
        compute in class java.util.concurrent.RecursiveAction

      • getThreshold

        public final int getThreshold()
        Get the threshold value for dividing into threads. If the number of individuals to evaluate is less than this number, do the evaluation directly.
        Returns:
        the threshold

      • setThreshold

        public final void setThreshold(int threshold)
        Set the threshold value for dividing into threads. If the number of individuals to evaluate is less than this number, do the evaluation directly.
        Parameters:
        threshold - the threshold to set
